## safeAwait() function

Execute a promise safely

**Signature:**

```typescript
export declare function safeAwait<T, U = Error>(
  promise: Promise<T>,
  errorExt?: object
): Promise<[U, undefined] | [null, T]>;
```

</td></tr>
<tr><td>

</td><td>

object

</td><td>

_(Optional)_ Additional Information you can pass safeAwait the err object { Promise }

</td></tr>
</tbody></table>

**Returns:**

Promise&lt;\[U, undefined\] \| \[null, T\]&gt;

## Example

async function asyncTaskWithCb(cb) { let err, user, savedTask, notification;

\[ err, user \] = await safeAwait(UserModel.findById(1)); if(!user) return cb('No user found');

\[ err, savedTask \] = await safeAwait(TaskModel(<!-- -->{<!-- -->userId: user.id, name: 'Demo Task'<!-- -->}<!-- -->)); if(err) return cb('Error occurred while saving task')

cb(null, savedTask); }
